definition: a metallic chemical element that is easily formed into sheets and wires and is one of the best known conductors of heat and electricity  — see Chemical Elements Table

definition: a chemical element that is a red-brown metal. Its symbol is Cu and it is used especially for making wire or pipes.
a police officer

definition: The term Copper was the original, unshortened word, originally used in Britain to mean "someone who captures". (In British English the term Cop is recorded (Shorter Oxford Dictionary) in the sense of 'To Capture' from 1704, derived from the Latin 'Capere' via the Old French 'Caper'). The common myth is that it's a term referring to the police officer's buttons which are made of copper.

the term "coppers" can be traced back tot he early 19th century in new york city when the first police force consisting of an 8 men unarmed patrol unit wore on their shirt an 8 point copper badge to distinguish themselves as officers of the law. as a result the general public started calling them coppers
